forecast.name: Juneteenth
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind around 24 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 52. West wind 20 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 32 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, a clear, sunlit day unfolds with temperatures lingering around a comfortable sixty-two degrees, albeit dipping slightly as the afternoon wears on. The vibrant blue sky stretches overhead, unmarred by the typical fog that often embraces this coastal city. A keen, brisk west wind sways through the streets, its playful gusts almost grounding the warmth of the day, while a twilight chill begins to dance in with the setting sun. As evening approaches, conditions will remain mostly clear, wrapping the city in a gentle serenity, with temperatures expected to drop to around fifty-two.

Dressing in layers is wise today; a light jacket or cardigan will seamlessly transition from the sun’s embrace to the cool evening air. With such delightful weather, a stroll along the Marina or a quiet moment amongst the greenery of Golden Gate Park beckons. Perhaps a leisurely visit to one of the charming cafes across the waterfront would provide the perfect backdrop for enjoying a warm drink as the sun bids farewell to the horizon, leaving a calm, vibrant afterglow in its wake.
